Key Match Events: Jayson Tatum had 33 points, nine assists, and eight rebounds.
Derrick White scored 26 points for Boston.
Sam Hauser hit five 3-pointers and scored 15 points.
Julius Randle led Minnesota with 27 points, eight rebounds, and seven assists.
Naz Reid added 20 points off the bench.
Jaden McDaniels had 19 points and eight boards.
Anthony Edwards' 3-pointer fell short at the buzzer.
Boston committed just four turnovers while the Timberwolves turned it over 16 times.
Post-Match Reflections: A victory in Minnesota was a great way for Boston to kick off a four-game road trip to start 2025.
Minnesota began the week with a chance to test itself against one of the heavy hitters in each conference.
Miscellaneous Highlights: With the Celtics leading 46-45 midway through the second quarter, Tatum hit the second of two free throws, then drained 3-pointers on Boston's next two possessions.
That was part of a 16-6 run to close the second quarter, sending the Celtics into the locker room with a 62-51 lead.
